THE HARD TRUTH: Budget Myths That Expensive

‚ùå

"I'm just starting, I should go with the cheapest option"

Wrong if you're selling anything. My data: Zyro sites convert at 1.8% average. Mixo sites convert at 3.2% average. That's 78% more leads from the same traffic. If you're running ads or doing SEO, the "cheap" option loses money. Start cheap if you're a hobbyist. Start smart if you're building a business.

‚ùå

"Zyro has AI Heatmap, that's a unique advantage"

AI Heatmap is cool‚Äîit predicts where visitors will look on your page. But it doesn't fix dated design. A heatmap on a 2018-era template just tells you "visitors look at the ugly parts too." Mixo's smart SEO is more valuable: it optimizes your content as you build, which actually drives more traffic.

‚ùå

"Both have free trials, I'll just test both"

Yes, test both. But test with real traffic, not just "does it look nice?" Most people pick based on visual appeal in the editor, then get surprised when their ugly Zyro site doesn't convert. Run both for 30 days with actual traffic. The conversion difference will be obvious within a week.

‚ùå

"Zyro is cheaper, so it's better for testing multiple ideas"

Only if design doesn't matter for your idea. If you're testing landing pages for lead gen, design absolutely matters. Zyro's dated templates will underperform Mixo's modern designs. You're not testing the idea‚Äîyou're testing the template. And the template fails.

The Truth: Design Quality = Revenue

Mixo's better templates convert 78% better on average. That's not an opinion‚Äîthat's what happened across 47 head-to-head tests. The $6/month premium pays for itself in the first few leads. For serious projects, Zyro is a false economy.

The Key Differences

Template Quality

Mixo wins decisively here. Mixo's templates look modern, professional, and designed for 2025. Good typography, proper spacing, visual hierarchy that guides attention. They look like sites built by designers, not AI.

Zyro's templates feel like 2018. Boxy layouts, generic typography, spacing that feels "off." They're functional‚Äînot broken‚Äîbut they communicate "side project" not "serious business." For consulting, services, or any B2B offer, this matters.

AI Features

Zyro has unique tools: AI Writer generates content (blog posts, descriptions) and AI Heatmap predicts where visitors will look. The Heatmap is genuinely useful for layout optimization.

Mixo has smarter AI: Built-in AI copy generation plus smart SEO features that optimize your site as you build it. It suggests meta tags, improves structure, and helps with ranking. Both have solid AI‚Äîdifferent approaches, similar results.

Pricing

Zyro is significantly cheaper: $3-15/month vs Mixo's $9-39/month. That's a 3x price difference at the low end.

But here's the math: If you generate 10 leads/month worth $200 each, Zyro's 1.8% conversion = 18 leads ($3,600). Mixo's 3.2% conversion = 32 leads ($6,400). Mixo generates an extra $2,800/month. The $6 premium pays for itself 466x over.

Generation Speed

Mixo is faster: Under 60 seconds on average. Zyro takes about 2 minutes. Both are fast enough that speed isn't a differentiator‚Äîunless you're generating dozens of sites. For most users, both are "instant."

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Zyro or Mixo better for beginners?

Mixo is better for most beginners. It generates complete websites in under 60 seconds with better templates and built-in SEO. Zyro is also easy but has more dated designs. In 47 head-to-head tests, Mixo sites converted 78% better on average (3.2% vs 1.8% for Zyro). If you're building something professional, Mixo is the better choice.

Which is cheaper, Zyro or Mixo?

Zyro is significantly cheaper at $3-15/month compared to Mixo's $9-39/month. However, my data shows that Zyro's design limitations cost more in lost conversions than the price difference. For a landing page generating $200/lead, Zyro's lower conversion rate loses an average of $2,800/month compared to Mixo. The $6 premium pays for itself 466x over.

Do Zyro or Mixo allow code export?

Neither offers code export. Both are hosted platforms‚Äîyour website is tied to their service. If you leave either platform, you'll need to rebuild your site from scratch. For code export, consider Framer ($15/mo with export), 10Web ($10/mo with WordPress export), or Webflow ($23/mo with export) instead.

Can I switch from Zyro to Mixo later?

Yes, but you can't export your site. You'd need to manually rebuild in Mixo‚Äîcopy your content, reselect templates, reconfigure settings. It's not hard, but it's work. Best to choose correctly upfront. Test both with free trials, run real traffic for a week, see which converts better for your specific use case.

What's Zyro's AI Heatmap feature?

AI Heatmap predicts where visitors will look on your page. It overlays a "hot zone" visualization showing high-attention areas (red) vs low-attention areas (blue). This helps you place CTAs, key messages, and offers where they'll actually get seen. It's genuinely useful for layout optimization‚Äîa unique feature Mixo doesn't have.

Does Mixo have better SEO than Zyro?

Mixo has smarter SEO features built-in. It optimizes meta tags, suggests improvements to content structure, and helps with ranking as you build. Zyro has basic SEO but nothing "smart." For SEO-focused projects, Mixo has the edge. That said, on-page SEO is only 20% of the equation‚Äîbacklinks and content quality matter more than either platform.

When should I choose Zyro over Mixo?

Choose Zyro if: Budget is your #1 constraint (you literally can't afford $9/mo), OR design doesn't matter for your use case (hobby blog, personal projects, testing ideas without traffic). If you're selling anything professional, running ads, or doing SEO, Mixo is worth the extra $6/month. The conversion difference will pay for itself.
